title: Quality Standards
description: Principles defining the quality bar that all work must meet
philosophy: Quality is not an accident; it is always the result of intelligent effort.

principles.name: Test Coverage Required
principles.statement: All code changes must include appropriate test coverage
principles.rationale: Tests verify that code works as intended
exceptions: Prototype/spike code explicitly marked as such

principles.name: Documentation Required
principles.statement: All public interfaces must be documented
principles.rationale: Documentation enables understanding and correct usage

principles.name: Comprehensive Error Handling
principles.statement: All error conditions must be handled with clear, actionable messages
principles.rationale: Good error handling prevents harm and enables debugging

principles.name: Peer Review Required
principles.statement: All code changes require peer review before merge
principles.rationale: Multiple perspectives catch issues and improve quality

principles.name: Consistent Code Style
principles.statement: All code must follow the project's style guide
principles.rationale: Consistency reduces cognitive load and enables collaboration

principles.name: Type Safety
principles.statement: Public interfaces must have type annotations
principles.rationale: Types enable static verification and documentation

principles.name: Security Standards
principles.statement: Code must follow security best practices
principles.rationale: Security protects users and systems from harm
